discovery_rule.name: SMART disk discovery
discovery_rule.description: By default, every 12 hours LLD will be gathered and 80 seconds after (configurable in script) trapper items will be sent to server. Note: at the moment windows items are sent only on second run (after discovery).

item_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Specified load-unload count over device lifetime
{#DVALUE1}: [1]{#SMARTNAME} (current/cumulative)
item_prototype.description: 01 Raw Read Error Rate High values on Seagate, Samsung and Fujitsu are normal.

item_prototype.name: {#DVALUE184}: [184]{#SMARTNAME} (cumulative)
item_prototype.description: 184 (B8) End-to-End Error Indicates errors with drive cache.

item_prototype.name: {#DVALUE192}: [192]{#SMARTNAME} (cumulative)
item_prototype.description: 192 (С0) Power Off Retract Count (Emergency Retry Count)

item_prototype.name: {#DVALUE198}: [198]{#SMARTNAME} (current)
item_prototype.description: 198 (С6) Offline Uncorrectable Sector Count (Uncorrectable Sector Count)

item_prototype.name: {#DVALUE230}: [230]{#SMARTNAME}
item_prototype.description: 230 0xE6 GMR Head Amplitude (magnetic HDDs), Drive Life Protection Status (SSDs)

item_prototype.name: {#DVALUE232}: [232]{#SMARTNAME}
item_prototype.description: 232 0xE8 Endurance Remaining or Available Reserved Space

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: Attributes have been <= threshold at some time in the past
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 5: SMART status check returned "DISK OK" but we found that some (usage or prefail) Attributes have been <= threshold at some time in the past.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: Command line did not parse (smartmontools)
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 0: Command line did not parse.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: Device open failed
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 1: Device open failed, device did not return an IDENTIFY DEVICE structure, or device is in a low-power mode (see ´-n´ option above). (No such disk, permission denied, etc)

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: SMART status check returned "DISK FAILING"
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 3: SMART status check returned "DISK FAILING".

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: Some SMART or other ATA command to the disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 2: Some SMART or other ATA command to the disk failed, or there was a checksum error in a SMART data structure (see ´-b´ option above). Common issue for disks behind a RAID controller.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: The device error log contains records of errors
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 6: The device error log contains records of errors.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: The device self-test log contains records of errors
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 7: The device self-test log contains records of errors. [ATA only] Failed self-tests outdated by a newer successful extended self-test are ignored.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DDRIVESTATUS}: Unknown error while processing the disk
{#DDRIVESTATUS}: We found prefail Attributes <= threshold
trigger_prototype.description: man smartctl: Bit 4: We found prefail Attributes <= threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDBANDWIDTH}: Current bandwidth is less than maximum supported by the drive
{#DISKIDSAS}: Load-unload count has exceeded recommended maximum
trigger_prototype.description: SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Number of elements in grown defect list has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Number of elements in grown defect list is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Number of Non-Medium errors has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description:
May indicate problems with cables or controller.
SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Number of Non-Medium errors is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSAS}: Start-stop count has exceeded recommended maximum
trigger_prototype.description: SAS-only feature.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKIDSSD}: SSD wear is more than 70%
{#DISKIDSSD}: SSD wear is more than 85%
{#DISKIDSSD}: SSD wear is more than 98%
{#DISKID}: Device name had changed on {HOST.NAME}
{#DISKID}: Firmware version had changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger only if disk was NOT replaced.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKID}: No SMART values were discovered
{#DISKID}: Serial number had changed on {HOST.NAME}
{#DISKID}: SMART is available but disabled
trigger_prototype.description: It should be turned on in BIOS or with command 'smartctl --smart=on /dev/sdx'.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISKID}: SMART is unavailable - device lacks SMART capability
{#DISKID}: SMART self-test had FAILED on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE5}: [5]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE5}: [5]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE10}: [10]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: May indicate bad power connection or power supply.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE11}: [11]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Drive requires attention.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE184}: [184]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE187}: [187]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE187}: [187]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
{#DVALUE188}: [188]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Faulty data cable, power cable or power supply may be the reason.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE188}: [188]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Faulty data cable, power cable or power supply may be the reason.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE197}: [197]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Number of sector candidates for reallocation. Can be a software-bad. Can be cleared with full format as last resort.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE198}: [198]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: This drive need an offline self-test.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE199}: [199]{#SMARTNAME} has changed within past 5 days on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: This means you probably need to check your cables and device ports.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DVALUE200}: [200]{#SMARTNAME} is more than 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Drive requires attention.

trigger.name: App smartmontools: No disks were found for SMART test on {HOST.NAME}
App smartmontools: smartctl was not found in PATH or manually on {HOST.NAME}
App smartmontools: Something went wrong on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Something went wrong: check permissions, admin access, etc.

trigger.name: App smartmontools: Template is assigned, but no data recieved on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: If template is assigned to the host, but no data is gathered within 5 days.
